article.title: Majority of UCSB Emails Now Phishing Scams
article.description: This just in: UCSB’s automated email-delivery service has recently broken a new record! It has been revealed that — for the first time — phishing scams now make up the majority of the not...
article.content:
Emma Demorest / Daily nexus

 

This just in: UCSB’s automated email-delivery service has recently broken a new record! It has been revealed that — for the first time — phishing scams now make up the majority of the notifications sent to students by this system. In the wake of this revelation, students and faculty alike have expressed great concern over the security of the university’s primary messaging system.

“Wait, so you’re telling me they’re not forgiving all my student loans?!” second-year student Gilly Bull said. “I gave them my social security number, bank account number and mother’s maiden name,” she added. “Do you think that’s bad?”

Administration officials have yet to release an official statement on the duplicitous nature of their notification system, though several have allegedly released follow-up emails warning of the dangers of phishing scams. The authenticity of these follow-up emails is currently also under suspicion, however, as most of them begin with: “CONGRATULATIONS! You’re the 10,000th student to receive this notification!!! Click the link below to receive your free prize!!!”

In an attempt to glean some more insight into the phishing process, Nexustentialism reached out to well-known phishing connoisseur and supposed Nigerian prince, Mahnay Pleesi, for his take on this situation.

“There’s only one way to put a stop to these fraudulent emails for good,” he said. “All you have to do is wire $500 in Bitcoin directly to the following account, and all your troubles will be gone.”

Nexustentialism would have sent the requested funds but was halted by the fact that we don’t make that much money in a year and because our editor in chief said “no.” If, however, you would like to see this issue resolved once and for all, simply send a cashier’s check for $1,000 in an unmarked envelope directly to the Daily Nexus office. Your contributions are greatly appreciated.

An explanation as to why the university’s cybersecurity is so often thwarted has yet to be found. Faculty members from the computer science department were contacted for further information but offered little insight.

“Not my problem,” one professor of computer science told Nexustentialism. “They don’t pay me nearly enough to clean up that mess.” 

 

Little known fact: Max Myszkowski is actually a Nigerian prince.

Print
Max Myszkowski

Max Myszkowski is a third-year chemistry major who has an unhealthy obsession with Storke Tower and currently serves as the editor of Nexustentialism. He is illiterate.

related.title: Twitter Threatens Male Masculinity
related.description: In case you missed it, Twitter unveiled a new way to show your appreciation of another person’s tweet this week. Instead of having the option to “favorite” a tweet with a star, you now “like�...
related.content:
In case you missed it, Twitter unveiled a new way to show your appreciation of another person’s tweet this week. Instead of having the option to “favorite” a tweet with a star, you now “like” a tweet with a heart. And a lot of straight cisgender dudes are freaking out about it.

Yes, the straight cisgender males are at it again. They are putting down their brose, tightening up their man buns and putting their rulers back in their underwear drawers to fight against another cause that clearly threatens the very fabric of their being: a button on Twitter.

Some of these guys actually think that if they like another one of their bro’s tweets, it will indicate that they want to bust open the gateway to homosexual happenings and make passionate love to them.

via twitter.com

via twitter.com

via twitter.com

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

But then you find tweets like this and you realize exactly why some dudes are up in arms about the whole concept of having a heart indicate you like what another dude had to say.

via twitter.com

It is the same reason why men have man buns, burn man cave candles, rock man bags, sip brose and whisper “no homo” when they like another guy’s tweets: Masculinity is so fragile. Somehow it has been construed that sending someone a heart defines your sexuality. I send girls hearts all the time, but that does not mean I am going to stop wanting to date guys. It is meant to show that you LOL’ed or laughed your ass off. I mean, would it be better if Twitter made a button specifically to protect the masculinity of insecure men? Here is an option:

via tumblr.com

Think about it — the more they like a tweet, the bigger the penis-sized button. Sensitive dudes across the Twittersphere will rejoice as they assert their dominance over their bros with gigantic dick-shaped likes! That is what masculinity is all about after all, right? And we would not want to threaten that.

Print

related.title: Controversial Starbucks Cup Breaks Silence
related.description: After weeks of silence, I have decided it is time for me to make my statement. I know many of you have been waiting for this moment, so I will keep this short and to the point. Why the hell are so man...
related.content:
via knowyourmeme.com

After weeks of silence, I have decided it is time for me to make my statement. I know many of you have been waiting for this moment, so I will keep this short and to the point. Why the hell are so many of you conflicted about my presence? I mean, I am literally a cup.

For those of you taking my presence as an affront to the “Christian values” of this country and as another assault against the “War on Christmas,” you are making me feel very attacked right now. We had such a great run the last few decades when I had snowmen, deer and other winter designs, but now that I’m just plain red, you have turned against me. Suddenly, you all mock me and draw all over my face as if I am just a piece of cardboard you can take advantage of. I am a real cup with real feelings. I cannot help that a bunch of people at Starbucks corporate wanted to streamline my look with a minimalistic approach. Why would anyone want to hurt something so bad for the way that it was made?

For my social justice warriors, hear me out. I love that you fight the good fight online. You have all faithfully stood by me with your comments on your family members’ Facebook posts and in other social media outlets. However, I am going to need you to stop with the hypersensitivity. My design this year is nothing more than a modernization meant to keep up with the times. People like minimal these days, so I was created to reflect that. My design is in no way making a commentary on political correctness. I mean, do you really think that my designers were thinking, “We should make something that will be inclusive for all people!”? No, the only thing that they had in mind was, “It is getting cold out and people are going to want a warm beverage out of a seasonal cup.” They want to reflect the tastes of the masses, so here I am! Again, thank you, but no thank you.

All in all, I will say that you have way too much time on your hands if you are complaining about little old me. Why are you worrying so much about my design and not the fact that there are millions of other cups just like me destroying the environment? Or, I don’t know, have you been paying attention to what ISIS has been up to lately? While it is nice to be the center of attention, for good or bad, there are a lot more important things going on out there other than whether or not I do or do not have the Nativity scene branded on my ass.

Print

related.title: UCSB Goes D-1 in Gaucho Ball
related.description: First things first: it’s Gaucho Ball, not “Rage Cage” — show some school pride for crying out loud. Second things second: UCSB has officially qualified as Division 1 in our sacred drink...
related.content:
Emma Demorest / Daily Nexus

 

First things first: it’s Gaucho Ball, not “Rage Cage” — show some school pride for crying out loud. Second things second: UCSB has officially qualified as Division 1 in our sacred drinking ritual! As of this summer, UCSB is officially leading the world in competitive drinking. With an incoming class ready to fill the team roster with thousands of prospective red Solo stackers and thousands of seasoned, veteran players already enrolled, the new team is already set up for one hell of a season. 

“This almost makes up for the fact that we don’t have a football team,” said third-year student Talia Gaiter. “Now we can drink before, during and after sporting events — we really are a world-class institution.”

Anyone who has played a round or two of this game can attest to the intense pressure that steadily rises as the stack of cups into which you must bounce your ping pong ball grows taller and taller. This growing tension in the game, coupled with the brilliant catharsis of the full beer awarded (most often punitively) to the person who gets the last cup, provides the perfect story arc to each playthrough of the game. 

As a show of respect to our forefathers, the inventors of this fast-paced drinking game, we as Gauchos ought to honor their contributions to the art of turning casual drinking into a frenzied panic over who’s getting the bitch cup. Masters of their craft, the alumni who pioneered this field of competitive drinking have long since put away their ping pong balls and red Solo cups, but thankfully we, the current students of UCSB, have dutifully carried on their legacy, elevating this sport to previously unimaginable heights. 

Much in the same way oral histories and traditions have been passed down through generations for millennia, perhaps Gaucho Ball will one day cement its place in the collective consciousness as a fundamental part of the human condition. If not, then it has at least certainly cemented itself as the easiest way to get drunk off free alcohol at a stranger’s party without getting caught.

 

Max Myszkowski made the team and will be redshirting this season. 

Print
Max Myszkowski

Max Myszkowski is a third-year chemistry major who has an unhealthy obsession with Storke Tower and currently serves as the editor of Nexustentialism. He is illiterate.
